description: A small, brightly colored fish known for its symbiotic relationship with sea anemones. Found in warm waters of the Indo-Pacific region.
A vibrant blue fish with a distinctive shape, popularized by the movie 'Finding Nemo'. Found in coral reefs of the Indo-Pacific.
A bright yellow fish commonly found in Hawaiian waters. Important for coral reef health as it feeds on algae.
A distinctive fish with a long dorsal fin and black, white, and yellow coloration. Found in tropical waters worldwide.
A beautiful angelfish with alternating blue and yellow stripes. Found in coral reefs of the Indo-Pacific region.
A large, colorful angelfish with distinctive blue and yellow patterns. Juveniles have different coloration than adults.
A venomous fish with striking red, white, and black stripes. Native to the Indo-Pacific but invasive in the Atlantic.
A colorful fish with a distinctive shape and strong jaws. Known for its territorial behavior and ability to change color.
A colorful fish with beak-like teeth used to scrape algae from coral. Plays a crucial role in coral reef health.
A small, colorful fish with a distinctive black spot on its dorsal fin. Found in coral reefs worldwide.
A colorful fish that changes sex during its lifetime. Important for reef health as it feeds on parasites.
A large, predatory fish found in coral reefs. Important for maintaining the balance of reef ecosystems.
